caption: Peaceful and beautiful, used to be the manor of the Ministry of Finance under Louis III in the 17th century. Now is The headquarters of the Centre des Monuments Nationaux.  Free admission.
Beautiful , Lovely and peaceful jardin. Not a big one but really nice to enjoy your silence moments here or reading a book, eat your packed meals, or just enjoying the flowers and people watching.

This place is truly an oasis, allowing escape from the busy Rue du Rivoli. It's a charming spot for a picnic, and it's usually much quieter than the neighbouring Place des Vosges (also a beautiful locale). I always walk through on my way back from shopping, and I also love to go there for a lunch break, or to read.
Lovely peaceful gardens, one of many peaceful tranquil out of the way spots to be found, during our visits there is always plenty of seating, and not as crowded as you might think.

There is quite a bit of history to Hotel de Sully that is connected to the larger backstory of the Place des Vosges. The "Free Tours by Foot" with Patrick was highly informative and we learned a lot about this Hotel (which basically meant it was a place of residence, not transient lodging). Definitely one of those places where you have to know what you're looking at to fully appreciate the significance.

This isolated garden is situated between the Hotel de Sully, a 16th century Louis XIII style mansion entered from the Rue de Rivoli ((which now features the centre of monuments nationaux- not open to the public, but the vast bookstore is open to the public))and the Place des Vosges (( a stunning green space with restaurants and art shops )). It is very possible to find peaceful moments in this garden between the Rue de Rivoli and the Place des Vosges.
Another version of Jardin du Palais Royal to me! A hidden gem in bustling Paris and busy Le  Marais. Definitely worth visiting if you love outdoor garden and French architecture.
A pittoresk place connected to the place de Vosges in Le Marais in Paris. It’s a place to comfort and enjoy out of the hectic of the streets. Just watch walk and enjoy

A beautiful little courtyard that you can stumble upon through a doorway in the south-west corner of Place des Vosges. At the other end one can walk through to a very different main street with a supermarket etc.
Cute secret garden.
A beautiful oasis of calm in the middle of Marais.
Hidden in one of the corners of Place des Vosges, don't miss this place
Beautiful hidden gem in the centre of Paris/le Marais. Very quiet and unknown. Would advise to give it a go!
Very pretty
very beautiful place. this garden is hidden from prying eyes
it is connected with Place des Vosges and both form an interesting route
Good place to rest and get some air
Hidden gem - garden next to the one of the most beautiful private mansions in Paris.
Stumbled upon this hidden gem, it was so beautiful and serene. It would be nice to spend some time just sitting on one of the benches.
Stunning and beautifully quiet location off of the beaten path

The sign said the garden is closed for work starting November 2022 for two months (No firm date for reopening). Opening a door in a dark corner of Place Des Vosges and stepping into this garden is a magical experience, but not right now!
This is a hidden heaven! Top!
A nice escape from the bustling streets of La Marais. Very pretty
A cute little garden used as a cut through to Place des Vosges. There is not a lot to do here other than pass through.
Very nice place opposite the Marais Jardin. Is't worth to visit.
It is quite a sudden moment for us to found the garden. It is calm and relax which is opposed to the outside.
Beautiful little hidden gem. It would be a great place to relax after a long day of walking.
Pretty, but definitely not worth a visit when you're not around the corner.
I loved this quite courtyard. It's in the Hotel De Sully and it's a very quite peaceful place.
There is a very rude  French people work here, threatening me to take my dog out, but I checked there’s no sign says dog is forbidden in this park, disappointed.
Stunning!!! What a gem
Historic, marvellous, a hidden corner of Paris right next to the place des Vosges.
A real gemm in the heart of Paris
One of my favorite private spot in town
Top...
Great place to see the old architecture and to relive history.
A true hidden gem - a definite must go
A hidden little gem near the Vosges park
